ComicInfo.Inker: Antonio Conversano,Chris Irving,Ed Coutts,Mark G. Heike
ComicInfo.Notes: Tagged with comicbox 1.2.0 on 2024-11-30T20:44:39 [Issue ID 4000-123900] urn:comicvine:4000-123900
ComicInfo.Summary:
This issue is a real potpourri of top-flight “good girl art” action, starting off with an awesome painted cover of Buckaroo Betty, done by Ed Coutts. It fronts for the way-out Western story that Ed and writer Paul Monsky crafted, ” The Devil’s Right Hand”. Spagetti Westerns were never like this- unless served with a generous helping of cheesecake!! The unpredictable Rad and her sometimes-partner The Black Terror open up with the first installment of their multi-issue manhunt for an old enemy in “Mission Prometheus- Part One”, written and inked by multitalented Chris Irving, and drawn by talented newcomer Kevin Stokes. Team leader Ms. Victory gets the solo spotlight in a tale of urban action called “The Getaway” by the team of writer Enrico Toeodorani and Antonio Conversano. The bodacious Blue Bulleteer braks up an arcane human sacrifice in the short feature titled “Rites of Evil”, also by Teodorani and Conversano. The talented Italian team returns for a third round this issue, a Cave Girl jungle action guest-story, “Cave Girl vs The Sons of N’Drokk” Speaking of guest-stars, Miss Masque appears in an untold tale set in the late 1940′s, “My Own Murder”, written by the prolific Chris Irving (with edits by Stephanie Sanderson-Heike) and art by Ollie Drac and Mark G. Heike. Six where else can you find six different beauitiful and buxom heroines, in six different stories, all in one great comic? 44 pages, black & white with color covers, standard comic book size.
The lead story is a tale of Buckaroo Betty set in the Old West as she tracks cattle rustlers and then has a run-in with a notorious outlaw! Written by Paul Monsky with art by Ed Coutts.
ComicInfo.Title: The Sons of N'Drokk; My Own Murder; The Getaway; Rites of Evil; The Devil's Right Hand; Mission Prometheus: Part One
